Animated adventure, with the voices of Meg Ryan, John Cusack and Kelsey Grammer.(n)

programme.title: The Flintstones in Viva Rock Vegas
programme.desc: Young courting couples Fred and Wilma, and Barney and Betty are invited to stay at a luxury casino in the Stone Age gambling capital. Owner Chip Rockefeller is bent on stopping Fred proposing to wealthy Wilma, because he wants to marry her himself for the money and settle his debts. Family comedy prequel, with Mark Addy, Stephen Baldwin, Joan Collins, Alan Cumming, Kristen Johnston and Jane Krakowski.(n)

programme.title: The GadgetGang! In Outer Space
programme.desc: A spaceship crashes to Earth, revealing a group of quirky little space aliens on the run for their lives. Animated adventure, featuring the voices of Brian Munn, Antony Salerno and David McDonald.(n)

programme.title: An Eskimo Tale
programme.desc: When animals start mysteriously disappearing, three young Inuits embark on a perilous journey to save their tribe from ruin. Animated adventure, with the voice of Christopher Plummer.(n)

programme.title: Monster Family
programme.desc: A young family cursed by a witch and transformed into monsters. Animated comedy, with the voices of Emily Watson, Jason Isaacs and Nick Frost.(n)

programme.title: Captain Underpants: The First Epic Movie
programme.desc: A pair of elementary school pranksters inadvertently transform their mean-spirited principal into a daring vigilante. Cartoon adventure, with the voices of Kevin Hart, Thomas Middleditch and Ed Helms.(n)

programme.title: Cop and a Half: New Recruit
programme.desc: A veteran detective teams with a tech-savvy 12-year-old to take down serial prankster the Badge Bandit. Family adventure, with Lou Diamond Phillips and Lulu Wilson.(n)

programme.title: Kubo and the Two Strings
programme.desc: A young boy embarks on an epic quest when he inadvertently summons vengeful spirits from his past. Bafta-winning animated adventure, with the voices of Charlize Theron, Art Parkinson and Matthew McConaughey.(n)

programme.title: The Addams Family
programme.desc: Creepy couple Morticia and Gomez find their unconventional life threatened by a man claiming to be a long-lost relative. When they welcome him with open arms, they fall prey to a plot that could cost them their ancestral home and the family fortune. Black comedy based on the 1960s TV series, starring Anjelica Huston, Raul Julia, Christopher Lloyd, Christina Ricci, Jimmy Workman and Carel Struycken.(n)

programme.title: Monster Family
programme.desc: A young family cursed by a witch and transformed into monsters. Animated comedy, with the voices of Emily Watson, Jason Isaacs and Nick Frost.(n)

programme.title: Captain Underpants: The First Epic Movie
programme.desc: A pair of elementary school pranksters inadvertently transform their mean-spirited principal into a daring vigilante. Cartoon adventure, with the voices of Kevin Hart, Thomas Middleditch and Ed Helms.(n)

programme.title: Kubo and the Two Strings
programme.desc: A young boy embarks on an epic quest when he inadvertently summons vengeful spirits from his past. Bafta-winning animated adventure, with the voices of Charlize Theron, Art Parkinson and Matthew McConaughey.(n)

programme.title: Miss Peregrine's Home For Peculiar Children
programme.desc: A misfit teen discovers an island orphanage that's home to children with very special gifts, but the forces of darkness are soon snapping at his heels. Tim Burton's adaptation of the cult Ransom Riggs novel, starring Asa Butterfield, Eva Green and Samuel L Jackson.(n)

programme.title: The Water Horse: Legend of the Deep
programme.desc: A lonely boy living in the Scottish Highlands during the Second World War stumbles on a curiously large egg by the water's edge of the local loch. Astonishingly, it hatches into a cute baby sea monster and, although he tries his hardest to keep it concealed, the task is made almost impossible by the creature's alarming rate of growth. Children's fantasy adventure, based on the book by Dick King-Smith, with Alex Etel, Emily Watson and David Morrissey.(n)

programme.title: Bugsy
programme.desc: Fact-based crime drama about New York gangster Bugsy Siegel, who was sent to Los Angeles to take over the West Coast rackets, but fell for a glamorous starlet and embarked on a business venture to turn Las Vegas into a gamblers' paradise. Starring Warren Beatty, Annette Bening, Harvey Keitel and Ben Kingsley.

programme.title: The Hollow Point
programme.desc: A hard-drinking sheriff and his deputy are pitted against a sadistic cartel hitman. Crime thriller, starring Patrick Wilson, Ian McShane and John Leguizamo.

programme.title: Deep Family Secrets
programme.desc: A girl sets out on a personal quest to discover the truth about her mother's alleged abduction, and uncovers a tangled tale of adultery, incest and murder. Thriller, starring Richard Crenna, Angie Dickinson and Meg Foster.

programme.title: What Lies Beneath
programme.desc: A doctor's wife recovering from a car accident is troubled by terrifying visions of a ghostly girl who seems to be asking for help from beyond the grave. While her husband thinks the experiences are the result of her recent trauma, a psychiatrist urges her to communicate with the spirit. Supernatural thriller, starring Michelle Pfeiffer, Harrison Ford, Diana Scarwid and Joe Morton.

programme.title: Wall Street: Money Never Sleeps
programme.desc: Ruthless stockbroker Gordon Gekko is released from prison after eight years, reinventing himself as an author and lecturer warning against the dangers of the financial system. Gekko helps a young banker get revenge on the company that drove his mentor to suicide, but as always, has a crooked agenda of his own. Oliver Stone's sequel to his 1980s drama, with Michael Douglas, Shia LaBeouf and Carey Mulligan.

programme.title: Gran Torino
programme.desc: Misanthropic Korean War veteran Walt leads an isolated existence, and has a tense relationship with his family and nothing but contempt for his neighbours. When a teenager attempts to steal his prized car, he ends up trying to reform the thief, making a connection with the boy's relatives and defending them from a street gang. Drama, directed by and starring Clint Eastwood. With Christopher Carley and Bee Vang.

programme.title: Desierto
programme.desc: A group of immigrants hoping to make it across the US-Mexico border are targeted by a deranged, gun-wielding vigilante. Thriller, starring Gael Garcia Bernal and Jeffrey Dean Morgan.

programme.title: Ocean's Eleven
programme.desc: A suave ex-convict assembles a gang of sophisticated crooks to pull off a daring heist. He intends to rob three of Las Vegas's biggest casinos simultaneously - and also win back his estranged wife, who is now dating the ruthless owner of all three gambling establishments. Steven Soderbergh's crime comedy, starring George Clooney, Brad Pitt, Julia Roberts, Matt Damon and Bernie Mac.

programme.title: Ocean's Twelve
programme.desc: The crooks reunite when an old enemy catches up with them and demands they repay the money they stole from him three years previously. In response, the gang comes up with another larcenous plan - but reckons without the interventions of a fellow thief and a sultry Interpol agent. Crime caper sequel, starring George Clooney, Brad Pitt, Julia Roberts, Catherine Zeta-Jones, Matt Damon, Andy Garcia and Don Cheadle.

programme.title: City of Tiny Lights
programme.desc: A hard-drinking private detective searches for a missing sex worker, leading to a dangerous world of religious fanaticism and political intrigue. London-set crime thriller from Dredd director Pete Travis, starring Riz Ahmed, Billie Piper and James Floyd.

programme.title: Contraband
programme.desc: Successful international smuggler Chris Farraday turns his back on a life of crime to raise a family. However, his brother-in-law crosses a powerful drug lord, who forces Chris to transport billions of dollars of counterfeit money into the US, or his wife and children will be killed. Crime thriller, starring Mark Wahlberg, Kate Beckinsale, Giovanni Ribisi and Ben Foster.

programme.title: Blood Father
programme.desc: An ex-con battles to protect his estranged daughter from the cronies of her cartel member ex. Action thriller, starring Mel Gibson, Erin Moriarty and Diego Luna.

programme.title: Marked for Death
programme.desc: A former narcotics agent decides it is time to retire and settle down after his partner is killed. However, his peaceful retirement comes to an abrupt end when a villainous drug dealer known as Screwface tries to kill his sister and her daughter. The enraged operative pursues the crime lord to Jamaica in search of vengeance. Action thriller, starring Steven Seagal, Basil Wallace and Joanna Pacula.(n)

programme.title: Freehold
programme.desc: Fast-talking estate agent Hussein finds his personal and professional life unravelling as a wronged former client takes his revenge. Comedy horror, starring Javier Botet, Mandeep Dhillon and Mim Shaikh.(n)

programme.title: City of Tiny Lights
programme.desc: A hard-drinking private detective searches for a missing sex worker, leading to a dangerous world of religious fanaticism and political intrigue. London-set crime thriller from Dredd director Pete Travis, starring Riz Ahmed, Billie Piper and James Floyd.(n)

programme.title: Angel Flight Down
programme.desc: A mercy mission runs into difficulty when the plane commissioned to airlift a sick girl suffers engine trouble and crashes on the edge of a cliff. Drama, starring Patricia Kalember and David Charvet.(n)

programme.title: Miller's Crossing
programme.desc: A Mob boss watches as his empire crumbles around him after he refuses to have his girlfriend's brother killed. A disgruntled henchman responds by heading up a breakaway criminal faction, while the boss's right-hand man tries to decide where his loyalties lie. The Coen brothers' Prohibition-era gangster thriller, starring Gabriel Byrne, Albert Finney, Marcia Gay Harden and John Turturro.(n)

programme.title: Hard Eight
programme.desc: An unsuccessful gambler is befriended by a professional conman who offers to teach him the tricks of the trade. Delighted, he accepts - but an unscheduled romance with a waitress threatens his new life. Paul Thomas Anderson's crime drama, starring Philip Baker Hall, Gwyneth Paltrow, Samuel L Jackson and Philip Seymour Hoffman.(n)

programme.title: Red Dragon
programme.desc: The FBI agent who first captured Hannibal Lecter is called out of retirement to catch a demented murderer dubbed the Tooth Fairy, who slaughters a family whenever there is a full moon - forcing the detective to draw on the imprisoned cannibal's expertise in criminal psychology. Thriller prequel adapted from the first of Thomas Harris's Lecter novels, starring Anthony Hopkins, Edward Norton, Ralph Fiennes and Philip Seymour Hoffman.(n)

programme.title: Allied
programme.desc: A daring Canadian intelligence officer falls for a beautiful French resistance fighter during the Second World War. When they reunite in London, their relationship is tested by the pressures of conflict. Epic Robert Zemeckis thriller, starring Brad Pitt, Marion Cotillard and Jared Harris.(n)

programme.title: Drone
programme.desc: A drone pilot who's spent his career conducting covert operations from the comfort of his own home is finally forced to confront his actions. Thriller, starring Sean Bean, Patrick Sabongui and Mary McCormack.(n)

programme.title: Flightplan
programme.desc: A widow boards a plane with her daughter and promptly falls asleep. When she wakes up, the girl has disappeared - and the mother's fear turns to outright panic when the aircraft crew insists she boarded the flight alone, suggesting the child is merely a figment of her distressed imagination. Thriller, starring Jodie Foster, Peter Sarsgaard, Sean Bean and Greta Scacchi.(n)

programme.title: The Godfather
programme.desc: The patriarch of the Corleone crime family is hospitalised after an attempt on his life and entrusts control of his business to his three sons - the violent and unpredictable Sonny, the weak-willed Fredo, and Michael, the youngest brother, who reluctantly takes up the reins but proves to be the most ruthless of them all. Francis Ford Coppola's gangster drama, starring Marlon Brando, Al Pacino, James Caan, John Cazale, Talia Shire, Robert Duvall and Diane Keaton.(n)

programme.title: Captain Phillips
programme.desc: An American cargo ship sets a dangerous course around the coast of Somalia, while inland, four men are pressed into service as pirates by the local warlords. The captain is taken hostage when the raiding party hijacks the vessel, resulting in a tense five-day crisis. Fact-based thriller, starring Tom Hanks and Barkhad Abdi.(n)

programme.title: Along Came a Spider
programme.desc: A police forensic psychologist searches for the daughter of a senator, who has been kidnapped from her expensive private school by a media-obsessed teacher, sparking a desperate race to hunt down her psychotic and devilishly intelligent captor before it is too late. Thriller prequel to Kiss the Girls, starring Morgan Freeman, Monica Potter, Michael Wincott, Dylan Baker and Penelope Ann Miller.(n)

programme.title: Kidulthood
programme.desc: West London teenagers face difficult choices that could affect the rest of their lives, as they struggle to deal with the effects of gun crime, drugs and bullying in their impoverished neighbourhood. Drama, written by and starring Noel Clarke, with Aml Ameen, Red Madrell, Jaime Winstone and Rafe Spall.(n)

programme.title: Mine
programme.desc: Following a failed assassination attempt, a soldier is stranded in the desert where he must survive the elements and stay sane enough to survive. Thriller, starring Armie Hammer, Annabelle Wallis and Tom Cullen.(n)

programme.title: Point Last Seen
programme.desc: The head of a search and rescue team whose children were kidnapped by her ex-husband hunts obsessively for a girl gone missing in the desert. However, her search is interrupted by news that her spouse has been found - but the children he took are nowhere to be found. Fact-based drama, starring Linda Hamilton and Kevin Kilner.(n)

programme.title: xXx: The Return Of Xander Cage
programme.desc: The extreme sports-loving super spy is brought out of exile to retrieve a powerful weapon known as Pandora's Box. Action thriller, starring Vin Diesel, Donnie Yen and Toni Collette.(n)

programme.title: Unstoppable
programme.desc: A driverless train carrying a deadly cargo of toxic chemicals goes out of control. A veteran train operator and his rookie colleague set off in pursuit in their own locomotive, intending to bring it to a halt before it crashes and causes a major disaster. Action thriller, the final film from director Tony Scott, starring Denzel Washington, Chris Pine and Rosario Dawson.(n)

programme.title: The Taking of Pelham 123
programme.desc: Criminals hijack a crowded New York subway train and threaten to start shooting the passengers unless a $10million ransom is paid in one hour. However, the transport supervisor they issue their demands to begins to suspect the plot is part of an even grander scheme. Tony Scott's thriller remake, with Denzel Washington and John Travolta.(n)

programme.title: Safe House
programme.desc: A CIA agent stationed in South Africa is sent to question a rogue operative, who has been arrested years after betraying the agency, only to be attacked by mercenaries hired to capture the fugitive. As they flee for their lives, the interrogator has to contend with not only the enemies hunting them, but also the mind games of his prisoner. Thriller, with Denzel Washington and Ryan Reynolds.(n)

programme.title: Inside Man
programme.desc: A police hostage negotiator is called in when a robbery turns into a siege. The chairman of the bank involved is worried the mastermind behind the heist is set to disclose secrets he needs to stay hidden, so he enlists the help of a political fixer. However, the elaborate nature of the thief's plan looks set to keep him one step ahead of the law, and causes problems for the detective assigned to rectify the situation. Spike Lee's thriller, with Denzel Washington, Clive Owen, Jodie Foster, Christopher Plummer, Willem Dafoe and Chiwetel Ejiofor.(n)

programme.title: Unstoppable
programme.desc: A driverless train carrying a deadly cargo of toxic chemicals goes out of control. A veteran train operator and his rookie colleague set off in pursuit in their own locomotive, intending to bring it to a halt before it crashes and causes a major disaster. Action thriller, the final film from director Tony Scott, starring Denzel Washington, Chris Pine and Rosario Dawson.(n)

programme.title: The Taking of Pelham 123
programme.desc: Criminals hijack a crowded New York subway train and threaten to start shooting the passengers unless a $10million ransom is paid in one hour. However, the transport supervisor they issue their demands to begins to suspect the plot is part of an even grander scheme. Tony Scott's thriller remake, with Denzel Washington and John Travolta.(n)

programme.title: The Godfather: Part II
programme.desc: Mafia don Michael Corleone sets out to clinch a make-or-break deal with an ageing gangster - but his plans are blown apart by a traitor within the family. Michael's story is intercut with flashback sequences chronicling the early life of his father Vito, as he makes the shift from immigrant grocery-store clerk to Mob kingpin. Francis Ford Coppola's Oscar-winning crime drama sequel, with Al Pacino, Robert De Niro, Robert Duvall, Diane Keaton, Talia Shire, John Cazale, Michael V Gazzo and Lee Strasberg.(n)

programme.title: Raw
programme.desc: After a trainee vet and strict vegetarian is pressured into eating meat for the first time, she develops a craving for flesh. Horror, starring Garance Marillier, Ella Rumpf and Rabah Nait Oufella. In French.

programme.title: Bite
programme.desc: While on her hen night getaway, Casey, the bride-to-be, gets a seemingly harmless bite from an unknown insect, but soon develops a taste for human flesh. Horror, starring Elma Begovic, Annette Wozniak and Denise Yuen.

programme.title: DC Super Hero Girls: Hero of the Year
programme.desc: Wonder Woman, Supergirl, Batgirl and Bumblebee team up to try to stop Dark Opal, who targets the heroes and steals some of their most valued possessions to form the ultimate weapon. Animated fantasy adventure, with the voices of Grey Griffin and Sean Schemmel.

programme.title: Anaconda
programme.desc: Film-makers venture deep into the Amazon jungle to document the lives of a remote tribe. However, the expedition is hijacked by a crazed hunter who plans to use them as bait to catch a gigantic killer snake. Adventure, starring Jennifer Lopez, Jon Voight, Ice Cube, Eric Stoltz and Jonathan Hyde.

programme.title: Passengers
programme.desc: A spacecraft transporting thousands of people to a distant planet malfunctions. As woken travelling companions Jim Preston and Aurora Lane fall in love, they are soon on a collision course with more technical problems and a dark secret. Fantasy adventure, starring Jennifer Lawrence, Chris Pratt and Michael Sheen.

programme.title: Gattaca
programme.desc: In a future run by a genetically enhanced elite, a caretaker who was born unmodified is barred from all but the most menial jobs. He swaps identities with a former athlete who has lost the use of his legs in an accident, allowing him to realise his dream of joining the space programme. However, a murder investigation threatens to expose his deception. Sci-fi drama, starring Ethan Hawke, Uma Thurman and Jude Law.

programme.title: Anon
programme.desc: In a world without anonymity or crime, a detective meets a woman who threatens their security. Sci-fi thriller from Gattaca and In Time director Andrew Niccol, starring Clive Owen, Amanda Seyfried and Colm Feore.

programme.title: Bad Match
programme.desc: An internet-dating playboy finds his life spiralling out of control when he meets a woman online. Thriller, starring Jack Cutmore-Scott, Lili Simmons and Noureen DeWulf.

programme.title: Anaconda
programme.desc: Film-makers venture deep into the Amazon jungle to document the lives of a remote tribe. However, the expedition is hijacked by a crazed hunter who plans to use them as bait to catch a gigantic killer snake. Adventure, starring Jennifer Lopez, Jon Voight, Ice Cube, Eric Stoltz and Jonathan Hyde.

Fantasy adventure, starring Jennifer Lawrence, Chris Pratt and Michael Sheen.

programme.title: Anon
programme.desc: In a world without anonymity or crime, a detective meets a woman who threatens their security. Sci-fi thriller from Gattaca and In Time director Andrew Niccol, starring Clive Owen, Amanda Seyfried and Colm Feore.

programme.title: Bad Match
programme.desc: An internet-dating playboy finds his life spiralling out of control when he meets a woman online. Thriller, starring Jack Cutmore-Scott, Lili Simmons and Noureen DeWulf.

programme.title: Patient Seven
programme.desc: A renowned psychiatrist selects six mentally ill hospital patients to interview as part of research for his new book, and discovers one patient is connected to them all. Horror anthology, starring Michael Ironside, Jack Plotnick and Drew Fonteiro.(n)

programme.title: Double Date
programme.desc: A 29-year-old virgin and his extrovert mate get more than they bargained for when they meet beautiful sisters with a hidden agenda. Comedy thriller, starring Danny Morgan, Georgia Groome and Michael Socha.(n)

programme.title: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
programme.desc: A thoroughly ordinary man is hurled into an intergalactic adventure when Earth is destroyed to make way for a hyperspace bypass. Luckily, his friend, who turns out to be an alien, gives him a handy travel guide to help him make sense of the universe. Sci-fi comedy based on Douglas Adams' classic series, with Martin Freeman, Bill Nighy, Mos Def, Zooey Deschanel and Sam Rockwell. Stephen Fry is the guide's narrator.(n)

programme.title: Don't Breathe
programme.desc: A trio of thieves break into the house of a blind man who is not as helpless as he seems, and their hopes of walking away with a massive fortune do not go to plan. Horror, starring Stephen Lang, Jane Levy and Dylan Minnette.(n)

programme.title: Star Trek Beyond
programme.desc: After the USS Enterprise is attacked during a rescue mission, Kirk, Spock and the crew struggle for survival on an alien planet while their mysterious assailant carries out his plans. Sci-fi adventure, starring Chris Pine, Zachary Quinto and Idris Elba.(n)

programme.title: Blade Runner: Theatrical Version
programme.desc: A former cop in a bleak future Los Angeles is forced to return to duty for a mission to hunt down and kill a group of renegade android replicants. The fugitives have escaped from a space colony to find their creator on Earth, in a bid to prolong their limited lifespan. Ridley Scott's sci-fi thriller, in the cut originally released in cinemas, Starring Harrison Ford, Rutger Hauer, Sean Young and Daryl Hannah.(n)

programme.title: Annabelle: Creation
programme.desc: Twelve years after the death of their little girl, a dollmaker and his wife welcome a nun and several girls from an orphanage into their home. There they become the target of the craftsman's possessed creation, Annabelle. Horror, starring Anthony LaPaglia, Samara Lee and Miranda Otto.(n)

programme.title: The Top Ten Show
programme.desc: Which movies are doing the best business at home and across the pond? Clips from the UK and US Top Ten show you the best of what's on offer on the big screen.(n)

programme.title: Don't Breathe
programme.desc: A trio of thieves break into the house of a blind man who is not as helpless as he seems, and their hopes of walking away with a massive fortune do not go to plan. Horror, starring Stephen Lang, Jane Levy and Dylan Minnette.(n)

programme.title: Star Trek Beyond
programme.desc: After the USS Enterprise is attacked during a rescue mission, Kirk, Spock and the crew struggle for survival on an alien planet while their mysterious assailant carries out his plans. Sci-fi adventure, starring Chris Pine, Zachary Quinto and Idris Elba.(n)

programme.title: Blade Runner: Theatrical Version
programme.desc: A former cop in a bleak future Los Angeles is forced to return to duty for a mission to hunt down and kill a group of renegade android replicants. The fugitives have escaped from a space colony to find their creator on Earth, in a bid to prolong their limited lifespan. Ridley Scott's sci-fi thriller, in the cut originally released in cinemas, Starring Harrison Ford, Rutger Hauer, Sean Young and Daryl Hannah.(n)

programme.title: Annabelle: Creation
programme.desc: Twelve years after the death of their little girl, a dollmaker and his wife welcome a nun and several girls from an orphanage into their home. There they become the target of the craftsman's possessed creation, Annabelle. Horror, starring Anthony LaPaglia, Samara Lee and Miranda Otto.(n)

programme.title: Mother
programme.desc: A couple's relationship is tested when uninvited guests arrive at their home, disrupting their peaceful existence. Drama, starring Jennifer Lawrence, Javier Bardem, Ed Harris and Michelle Pfeiffer.(n)

programme.title: RoboCop
programme.desc: A police officer in a future Detroit ravaged by crime is seemingly killed in the line of duty, but is rebuilt as a law-enforcing cyborg by the corporation that has taken over running the force. He begins to remember his human life and seeks to bring his killers to justice - a mission that leads him to turn on his corrupt corporate masters. Sci-fi thriller, starring Peter Weller, Nancy Allen, Ronny Cox and Miguel Ferrer.(n)

programme.title: RoboCop 2
programme.desc: The cybernetic law enforcer returns to battle a deranged drug lord. Meanwhile, he is unaware the corporation that created him has scheduled his replacement by a more powerful version. To complete the new cyborg, they need a human brain, and a renegade scientist secretly implants the injured drug lord's brain into the robot, transforming it into an uncontrollable killing machine. Sci-fi thriller sequel, starring Peter Weller, Nancy Allen, Tom Noonan and Belinda Bauer.(n)

programme.title: Project: ALF
programme.desc: A lovable alien is captured by the US army who plan to destroy him, prompting two officers to come to his aid. Spin-off from the sci-fi comedy TV series, with Miguel Ferrer, Ed Begley Jr and Martin Sheen.(n)

programme.title: Planet of the Apes
programme.desc: A spaceship crash-lands on a mysterious planet where humans are mute creatures who find themselves at the mercy of intelligent apes. The world's simian rulers are horrified when one of the crew reveals he can speak and plan to have him killed, but two chimpanzee scientists intervene, determined to learn from the new arrival. Sci-fi drama, starring Charlton Heston, Roddy McDowall, Kim Hunter and Maurice Evans.(n)

programme.title: Beneath the Planet of the Apes
programme.desc: A second astronaut arrives on the strange simian-dominated world searching for his predecessor. As he journeys into the infamous forbidden zone, he discovers an underground cult of psychic mutants. Meanwhile, a military coup has taken place among the ape society, leading to an inevitable battle. Sci-fi sequel, with James Franciscus, Charlton Heston and Kim Hunter.(n)

programme.title: Escape from the Planet of the Apes
programme.desc: Intelligent chimpanzees Cornelius and Zira escape the destruction of their planet by travelling back in time to 1970s America. Although initially treated as celebrities, the government comes to regard the pair as a threat to the human race when it transpires that Zira is pregnant. Sci-fi adventure sequel, starring Roddy McDowall, Kim Hunter, Sal Mineo and Ricardo Montalban.(n)

programme.title: Conquest of the Planet of the Apes
programme.desc: In the near future, humanoid apes are used as slave labour by brutal humans. An intelligent chimpanzee, the son of two apes from a further distance in time, conceals his ability to speak and lives under the protection of a kindly circus master. But when he is exposed, he leads his fellow simians in a violent uprising. Sci-fi drama, presenting an origin story for the original movie, starring Roddy McDowall and Ricardo Montalban.(n)

programme.title: Battle for the Planet of the Apes
programme.desc: A race of intelligent chimps vies with warlike gorillas and deadly mutant humans for control of a post-apocalyptic Earth. The fifth and final instalment in the sci-fi adventure series, starring Roddy McDowall, Claude Akins and Paul Williams, and featuring a cameo appearance by John Huston.(n)

programme.title: War for the Planet of the Apes
programme.desc: Caesar and his apes are forced into a lethal clash with an army of humans led by a ruthless colonel. Fantasy adventure, starring Andy Serkis, Woody Harrelson and Steve Zahn.(n)

programme.title: Rogue One: A Star Wars Story
programme.desc: In a galaxy far, far away, maverick scientist's daughter Jyn Erso and the Rebel Alliance attempt to steal plans for a battle station capable of destroying entire worlds - the Death Star. Star Wars prequel set before the events of A New Hope, starring Felicity Jones, Diego Luna and Ben Mendelsohn.(n)

programme.title: Planet of the Apes
programme.desc: A spaceship crash-lands on a mysterious planet where humans are mute creatures who find themselves at the mercy of intelligent apes. The world's simian rulers are horrified when one of the crew reveals he can speak and plan to have him killed, but two chimpanzee scientists intervene, determined to learn from the new arrival. Sci-fi drama, starring Charlton Heston, Roddy McDowall, Kim Hunter and Maurice Evans.(n)

programme.title: War for the Planet of the Apes
programme.desc: Caesar and his apes are forced into a lethal clash with an army of humans led by a ruthless colonel. Fantasy adventure, starring Andy Serkis, Woody Harrelson and Steve Zahn.(n)

programme.title: Rogue One: A Star Wars Story
programme.desc: In a galaxy far, far away, maverick scientist's daughter Jyn Erso and the Rebel Alliance attempt to steal plans for a battle station capable of destroying entire worlds - the Death Star. Star Wars prequel set before the events of A New Hope, starring Felicity Jones, Diego Luna and Ben Mendelsohn.(n)

programme.title: Baskin
programme.desc: The members of a police squad expect a routine night's patrol, but when they are called in to assist another their colleagues, they stumble on a black mass being performed in an abandoned building. The ritual opens a portal, and the unsuspecting cops soon are dragged through it to Hell itself. Fantasy horror, starring Mehmet Cerrahoglu and Gorkem Kasal. In Turkish.

programme.title: A Man Alone
programme.desc: A gunman stumbles across the bodies of passengers murdered in a stagecoach robbery. Riding to the nearest town to report the crime, he finds himself accused of the killings and faces a battle to prove his innocence. Western, directed by and starring Ray Milland, with Raymond Burr, Lee Van Cleef, Mary Murphy and Ward Bond.

programme.title: None Shall Escape
programme.desc: German military officer Wilhelm Grimm is tried for crimes committed during the Second World War, and his life and career is shown in a series of flashbacks. Returning seriously injured and disenchanted from the Great War to a village on the German-Polish border, his subsequent actions caused him banishment from the community and he is attracted to the Nazi Party. Drama, starring Alexander Knox.

programme.title: Warlock
programme.desc: A ruthless vigilante is recruited as a sheriff to clean up the streets of a crime-ridden town, but his strong-arm tactics soon antagonise the townsfolk. When a woman turns up and accuses the lawman of murdering her fiance, the residents rally to her cause with the help of a rival gunslinger. Western, starring Henry Fonda, Richard Widmark, Anthony Quinn, DeForest Kelley and Dorothy Malone.

programme.title: Carry On Jack
programme.desc: A bumbling midshipman's uniform is stolen by a woman desperate to go to sea, who adopts his identity. Later, the hapless sailor is press-ganged on to the same ship as her. However, while trying to prove who he really is, he has to contend with mutinies, pirates and the Spanish Navy. Comedy, with Bernard Cribbins, Juliet Mills, Kenneth Williams and Charles Hawtrey.

programme.title: Last Holiday
programme.desc: A woman is told she has only weeks to live. Resolving to make the most of the time she has left, she heads for a French hotel presided over by her hero, a world-renowned chef, where her new-found passion for life has a remarkable effect on the other guests. Comedy, starring Queen Latifah, Gerard Depardieu, LL Cool J, Timothy Hutton and Giancarlo Esposito.

programme.title: Momentum
programme.desc: Premiere. A retired thief is persuaded to carry out one last diamond heist by her former partner, only to get mixed up in a murder. With a ruthless assassin on her trail, she must unmask the secret conspiracy that has manipulated her into the line of fire. Action thriller, starring Olga Kurylenko, Morgan Freeman and James Purefoy.

programme.title: The Bourne Legacy
programme.desc: The leaders of a secret government agency plan to eliminate several agents as part of a cover-up when they face having their dark secrets exposed. One of the targets is able to evade his fate and go on the run - but his escape is threatened by his dependence on drugs to boost his physical and mental capabilities. Spy thriller sequel, with Jeremy Renner, Rachel Weisz and Edward Norton.

programme.title: The Babadook
programme.desc: A widowed mother's life becomes increasingly stressful when her son becomes convinced that the monster in one of his books is real. As she struggles to cope with the boy's unusual behaviour and her own sense of isolation, she begins to share his belief in the creature. Horror, starring Essie Davis and Noah Wiseman.(n)

programme.title: Distant Drums
programme.desc: An army officer mounts a daring raid through the treacherous Florida swamplands. His mission is to take on a group of marauding Seminole rebels, as well as the gun runners who have been supplying them with weapons, and rescue a group of settlers who have been taken hostage by the tribe. Western, starring Gary Cooper, Mari Aldon, Richard Webb, Ray Teal and Arthur Hunnicutt.(n)

programme.title: The Tall Stranger
programme.desc: A Union soldier struggles to recover from a violent encounter with a gang of lawless cattle rustlers, but his recuperation is cut short as he works to ensure the safety of a group of Confederate homesteaders journeying north at the end of the Civil War. Western based on a novel by Louis L'Amour, starring Joel McCrea, Virginia Mayo, Michael Ansara and Michael Pate.(n)

programme.title: North to Alaska
programme.desc: Gold prospector Sam travels to Seattle to fetch his partner George's fiancee. When he discovers she has married someone else, Sam takes it upon himself to find a suitable replacement. Unfortunately, his attempts to bring the substitute bride and George together do not go to plan, and a conman is trying to get his hands on their gold. Comedy Western, starring John Wayne, Stewart Granger, Capucine and Ernie Kovacs.(n)

programme.title: The Ladykillers
programme.desc: A criminal mastermind and his gang come up with a cunning scheme to steal a fortune, but their plan is threatened by the unsuspecting elderly landlady of the boarding house they are staying in. They decide to dispose of her, which proves easier said than done. Classic Ealing comedy, with Alec Guinness, Peter Sellers, Herbert Lom, Katie Johnson, Cecil Parker, Danny Green and Jack Warner.(n)

programme.title: Men in Black
programme.desc: A streetwise cop is enlisted by a top-secret government force dedicated to policing alien visitors to Earth, teaming up with a veteran agent just as a body-swapping extraterrestrial giant insect begins a reign of terror throughout New York City. Sci-fi comedy, starring Will Smith, Tommy Lee Jones, Linda Fiorentino, Rip Torn and Vincent D'Onofrio.(n)

programme.title: Red
programme.desc: A retired CIA agent survives an assassination attempt and realises something in his past has made him a target. He sets out to reunite the members of his old hit squad to find out who is trying to kill them and why, but in the process, uncovers dangerous secrets. Action thriller, with Bruce Willis, Morgan Freeman, John Malkovich and Helen Mirren.(n)

programme.title: Machete Kills
programme.desc: The relentless Mexican mercenary is hired by the president of the United States for a vitally important mission. A billionaire arms dealer intends to start a nuclear war using a space-based weapon of mass destruction, but defeating his schemes involves a deadly encounter with a murderous master of disguise. Action thriller sequel, starring Danny Trejo and Mel Gibson.(n)

programme.title: An American Werewolf in London
programme.desc: A tourist is attacked while walking on the Yorkshire Moors and undergoes a terrifying metamorphosis, becoming a ravening werewolf whenever the moon is full. John Landis's horror comedy, starring David Naughton, Griffin Dunne and Jenny Agutter, with appearances by Brian Glover and Rik Mayall as unwelcoming locals in an isolated pub. Featuring special effects by Rick Baker.(n)

programme.title: Rugrats Go Wild
programme.desc: A leaky boat leaves the precocious youngsters stranded on a jungle island, but their luck changes when explorers the Wild Thornberrys come to their rescue. However, Thornberry dad Nigel loses his memory, so it falls to his daughter Eliza to save the day. Children's animated adventure, with the voices of Nancy Cartwright, Bruce Willis, Lacey Chabert, Elizabeth Daily and Tim Curry.(n)

programme.title: Film4 Interview Programmes
programme.desc: Stars and directors talk about making movies in this compendium of personal and practical reflections. Features Danny Boyle, Amy Schumer, Chiwetel Ejiofor and more.(n)

programme.title: Film4 Interview Programmes
programme.desc: Stars and directors talk about the experience of making movies in this compendium of personal and practical reflections.(n)

programme.title: Hotel for Dogs
programme.desc: An orphaned brother and sister face losing their beloved dog when they go into a foster home that does not allow pets. The kids find the ideal hiding place in an abandoned hotel, and set about transforming it into luxury canine accommodation for not just their beloved pet, but every stray in town. Family comedy, starring Emma Roberts, Jake T Austin, Don Cheadle and Lisa Kudrow.(n)

programme.title: Carry On Teacher
programme.desc: A headmaster hopes to land a more prestigious job at a better school, but his pupils do not want him to leave. When two inspectors pay a visit, the mischievous students see a chance to sabotage his career plans with a series of pranks. Comedy, starring Ted Ray, Kenneth Connor, Charles Hawtrey and Kenneth Williams.(n)

programme.title: Crocodile Dundee II
programme.desc: The rugged Australian adventurer sets out to save his reporter girlfriend from New York drug dealers. Having rescued her from their clutches, he realises they will soon be coming after him - so he decides to even the odds by luring them to the Outback for a final showdown. Comedy adventure sequel, starring Paul Hogan, Linda Kozlowski, John Meillon and Charles S Dutton.(n)

programme.title: Romancing the Stone
programme.desc: A romantic novelist goes in search of her kidnapped sister in the steamy jungles of South America, only to become the target of a villainous general who demands as a ransom the valuable treasure map in her possession. Help is at hand in the form of a craggy daredevil fortune hunter, who has his eye on a share of the profits. Comedy adventure, starring Michael Douglas, Kathleen Turner and Danny DeVito.(n)

programme.title: A Good Day to Die Hard
programme.desc: John McClane goes to Russia having received word that his estranged son Jack is in trouble with the law. He is surprised to discover Jack is secretly a CIA agent, and father and son join forces to take on the Russian Mob, who are engaged in a plot to steal nuclear weapons. Action adventure sequel, starring Bruce Willis and Jai Courtney.(n)

programme.title: Predator 2
programme.desc: A Los Angeles cop, working to bring down the city's drug gangs, suspects Jamaican criminals when he discovers several of his targets killed and skinned alive. However, the culprit behind the murders reveals himself to be an alien big-game hunter - with the stealth and guile to outwit the police and criminals alike. Sci-fi sequel, starring Danny Glover, Bill Paxton, Gary Busey and Maria Conchita Alonso.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: A minister comes to stay with the Waltons, but his presence soon sparks off all manner of religious ructions.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: The children prevent an injured orphan from killing a raccoon and take him under their wing - but soon wonder whether they have made the right decision.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.sub-title: The High Cost of Being Right
programme.desc: Jonathan Garvey loses everything in a tragic barn fire, so his wife Alice goes to work at the Post Office. But her well-meant gesture only does further damage to his pride.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Part one of two. A road-weary, aging boxer, who has sacrificed his family and his health for the only career he has ever known, meets his match in the ring in Walnut Grove.

programme.title: Providence
programme.desc: Tensions mount between Syd and Dr Baylor when they disagree over the treatment of a suicide victim. Drama, starring Melina Kanakarades and Mike Farrell.

programme.title: Providence
programme.desc: As the wedding draws nearer Syd suffers from nightmares about her big day. Drama, starring Melina Kanakarades and Mike Farrell.

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.desc: Jonathan falls in love with a woman he is trying to matchmake with another man, and Mark tries to persuade him to put his own happiness first for a change.

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.desc: God grants Mark the chance to go back in time and tell his now deceased grandfather that he loved him.

programme.title: The Engagement Ring
programme.desc: When a missing engagement ring turns up 40 years after it was lost, its appearance opens old wounds but also prompts a new romance to blossom. Romantic comedy, starring Patricia Heaton, Vincent Spano, Tony Lo Bianco and David Hunt.

programme.title: Missing Children: A Mother's Story
programme.desc: A dodgy adoption agency resorts to underhand tactics in an attempt to take away a woman's children. Drama, starring Mare Winningham, Polly Holliday, Kate Capshaw and John Anderson.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: John takes a job away from home to make money to pay Grandma's hospital bills. At the job, everyone in the office fears the manager who makes life miserable for all, forcing the Walton to reconsider his position.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: A travelling medicine salesman arrives in town claiming to be able to heal anything, but he faces condemnation when Mrs Oleson becomes seriously ill. Red Buttons guest stars.

programme.title: Mary Higgins Clark: Pretend You Don't See Her
programme.desc: A New York estate agent becomes the target of an assassin after she sees a murder take place. The police act quickly to ensure her safety, placing her in a witness protection programme that enables her to start a new life elsewhere. But increasingly sinister events force her to face the fact that her life might still be in danger. Thriller, starring Emma Samms, Beau Starr and Hannes Jaenicke.

programme.title: We'll Meet Again
programme.desc: A woman convicted of her husband's murder is released from prison and resolves to clear her name. She enlists the help of a TV reporter friend, and as the pair delve into the events surrounding the killing, they uncover a sinister secret and a conspiracy to keep it hidden at any cost. Crime thriller based on the book by Mary Higgins Clark, starring Laura Leighton, Brandy Ledford and Gedeon Burkhard.

programme.title: Forbidden Love
programme.desc: Part one of two. Historical drama detailing the complex relationship between Thomas Jefferson and his slave Sally. Starring Sam Neill and Carmen Ejogo.

programme.title: The Great Train Robbery
programme.desc: First of a two-part drama by Broadchurch writer Chris Chibnall telling the story of the most infamous heist in British history, beginning with the planning and execution of the crime from the perspective of the perpetrators themselves. After a robbery at Heathrow Airport in 1962, Bruce Reynolds sets his sights on another target - the plan being to rob the overnight mail train from Glasgow to Euston. A team is assembled, schemes are laid out and rehearsals begin. But despite their meticulous planning, the operation is compromised by an attack on the train driver and a botched getaway. Before long, the gang have become the most wanted men in Britain. Luke Evans, Paul Anderson, Martin Compston, Jack Roth and Neil Maskell star.

programme.title: Murder in My House
programme.desc: Lauren and her retired lawyer father, Stan, move to Philadelphia to start a new life in a peaceful neighbourhood. They learn the previous owner of their house was murdered and that his wife was sent to prison for the crime. Stan becomes convinced that the woman convicted of the killing is innocent, but their neighbour will go to any lengths to ensure the truth does not come out. Thriller, with Barbara Niven, Daniel J Travanti and Brent Donnelly.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: John and the family are puzzled by the cold manner of their new neighbours - until it comes to light that they suffered at the hands of the Nazis and are still afraid to reveal their ancestry.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: For years John has thrilled his family with tales of his old army friend Tip. However, when he pays a visit to Walton's Mountain, doubts creep in as to whether the children's hero is all he's cracked up to be after he starts a fire and accidentally shoots a dog.(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Part two of two. Charles takes part in a boxing match at a travelling show, little suspecting his opponent is dangerously ill.(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: The Ingalls family travels to a nearby town for the annual fair, where Caroline takes part in a competition for perfect pickles. Drama, starring Michael Landon.(n)

programme.title: Providence
programme.sub-title: Things That Go Bump in the Night
programme.desc: Syd loses her engagement ring while working a double shift on Hallowe'en. Drama, starring Melina Kanakaredes and Mike Farrell.(n)

programme.title: Providence
programme.desc: Syd's first shift working at a prison proves to be a shocking experience.(n)

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.desc: Jonathan comes to the aid of an illiterate basketball player whose career has been cut short by ill health, and helps him learn to read so he can secure a future outside the sport.(n)

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.desc: Jonathan tries to reunite a dying woman with her disapproving father, who has never forgiven her for having a child out of wedlock.(n)

programme.title: A Touch of Hope
programme.desc: A man discovers he has the abilities of a faith healer. Initially reluctant, he agrees to use his gift to help doctors, but only in emergency cases. However, many in the medical community are suspicious of his claims, a conflict that comes to a head when he is asked to bring a doubting doctor's daughter out of a coma. Fact-based drama, starring Anthony Michael Hall, CCH Pounder, Abraham Benrubi and Fay Masterson.(n)

programme.title: The Stepchild
programme.desc: As a woman recovers from the injuries she sustained during a home invasion that left her father dead, she begins to suspect that her stepmother was behind the attack. Thriller, starring Lauren Holly, Paul Johannson and Sarah Fisher.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Erin graduates from school, but is worried that she does not know what she wants to do with her life.(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: The Walnut Grove community intervenes after a badly beaten boy is found unconscious on the floor of his cabin, the victim of his father's drunken rage.(n)

programme.title: Mary Higgins Clark: Before I Say Goodbye
programme.desc: A tenacious businesswoman sets out to refute allegations that her recently deceased husband was involved in all manner of dodgy deals - but a string of nasty shocks awaits her. Mystery, adapted from a novel by Mary Higgins Clark, starring Sean Young, Ursula Karven, Peter DeLuise and Aaron Douglas.(n)

programme.title: Try to Remember
programme.desc: A detective's investigation into a series of murders prompts her to return to her home town. Though she is initially determined to find out whether the killings are linked to a tragic event years earlier, her misgivings begin to grow - and she realises that to solve the crimes she must face her own troubled past. Drama adapted from a tale by Mary Higgins Clark, starring Gabrielle Anwar, Max Martini and Gary Chalk.(n)

programme.title: Forbidden Love
programme.desc: Part two of two. Historical drama detailing the complex relationship between Thomas Jefferson and his slave Sally. Starring Sam Neill and Carmen Ejogo.(n)

programme.title: The Great Train Robbery
programme.desc: The police wake to the news of a robbery, but the full extent of the crime and its haul - £2.6million - only becomes evident over the following days. It's clear the local CID is ill-equipped to solve a case of such magnitude, so Scotland Yard is called in, with a six-strong team of detectives headed by the Flying Squad's enigmatic chief Tommy Butler. In a race against time, they set out to identify every criminal involved and bring them to justice before they flee the country - but even if they can, will they find the money? Jim Broadbent stars in the concluding part of the drama about the most infamous heist in British history, with George Costigan, Robert Glenister, Tim Pigott-Smith, Nick Moran and John Salthouse. Written by Broadchurch creator Chris Chibnall.(n)

programme.title: Christie's Revenge
programme.desc: Danielle Kind stars in this thriller as Christie, a teenage girl whose father committed suicide several years earlier. When she discovers that her wealthy uncle refused to give her dad the financial help he was desperate for, driving him to take his own life, Christie vows to get revenge. Cynthia Gibb and John Wesley Shipp co-star.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Jim Bob ends up in hospital with appendicitis, forcing Grandpa and John-Boy to rely on a famous author to help them complete an important contract.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Cousins Ham, Cora and Job come to stay on Walton's Mountain, but they prove to be out-and-out crooks.(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Amorous Walnut Grove newcomer Adam Simms falls in love with Miss Beadle, while his son Luke proves he's a chip off the old block by persuading Nellie Oleson to run away with him.(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: A Native American boy arrives in Walnut Grove seeking medical help for his desperately ill father, but faces racial hatred from the townsfolk. Drama, starring Michael Landon.(n)

programme.title: Providence
programme.desc: When she and Owen got their marriage licence, Syd begins to feel guilty about kissing Dr Baylor.(n)

programme.title: Providence
programme.desc: Syd misses her wedding shower, while Owen is invited to spend Thanksgiving with the Hansens.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Erin and Mary Ellen enter a traditionally all-male race to raise money for the war effort, with Elizabeth coaching them. Jeffrey dreams of meeting a movie star.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Jeffrey befriends a German prisoner of war who has escaped from a camp in North Carolina and hidden in the mountains, and the family asks him to join them for Christmas Eve.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Cindy is introduced to a self-help book on how to be the perfect wife, but when she follows the instructions found within she risks going into premature labour due to exhaustion.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: A soldier in Jason's company explains what is happening to the Jews at the hands of the Nazis in Europe. Meanwhile, Elizabeth gets teased for being such a smart student at school.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of Kathy McCormick
programme.desc: Romantic comedy about a woman from the wrong side of the tracks who falls for an elegant playboy and finds herself forced to lead a double life. Barbara Eden, Josh Taylor and Judy Geeson star.(n)

programme.title: Daniel's Daughter
programme.desc: A magazine editor receives news of her estranged father's death, and agrees to fulfil his final wish to scatter his ashes at the family's old home, an undertaking forces her to confront the past she left behind. Drama, starring Laura Leighton, London Angelis, Martin Doyle, Brandon Firla and Dorly Jean-Louis.(n)

programme.title: Danielle Steel's Daddy
programme.desc: An advertising executive's wife walks out, leaving him to raise their children alone - a problem compounded by his mother's death in a car accident. Drama, starring Patrick Duffy, Lynda Carter, Kate Mulgrew and featuring an early appearance by Ben Affleck.(n)

programme.title: At the Midnight Hour
programme.desc: A recently widowed scientist hires a nanny to care for his children, and surprises himself by falling head over heels in love with her. Romantic drama, based on Alicia Scott's best-selling novel, starring Simon MacCorkindale and Patsy Kensit.(n)

programme.title: Promises to Keep
programme.desc: An old man learns he has a terminal illness, and decides he needs to rebuild his relationship with the family he abandoned 30 years ago. However, his son finds it difficult to forgive him for leaving them. Drama, starring Robert Mitchum with his real-life son Christopher and great-nephew Bentley. With Tess Harper and Claire Bloom.(n)

programme.title: That'll Be the Day
programme.desc: A school dropout leaves home and drifts through a succession of dead-end jobs until he finds an outlet for his frustration in rock 'n' roll. Drama, starring David Essex, Ringo Starr, Keith Moon, Billy Fury, Robert Lindsay and Rosemary Leach.(n)

programme.title: Have You Seen My Son
programme.desc: A woman strives to find her sick son after he is kidnapped by her ex-husband. Drama, starring Lisa Hartman Black, William Russ, Jameson Parker, Anne Francis and Scott Hylands.(n)

programme.title: My Neighbour's Keeper
programme.desc: Kate works in a home for disadvantaged children and longs for kids of her own, but is unable to conceive. When her best friend is murdered, Kate adopts her two youngsters, but it is not long before those around her question whether she had a hand in their mother's death to gain the family she always wanted. Drama, starring Laura Harring and Linden Ashby.

programme.desc: A minister comes to stay with the Waltons, but his presence soon sparks off all manner of religious ructions.

When she discovers that her wealthy uncle refused to give her dad the financial help he was desperate for, driving him to take his own life, Christie vows to get revenge. Cynthia Gibb and John Wesley Shipp co-star.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Jim Bob ends up in hospital with appendicitis, forcing Grandpa and John-Boy to rely on a famous author to help them complete an important contract.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Cousins Ham, Cora and Job come to stay on Walton's Mountain, but they prove to be out-and-out crooks.(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Amorous Walnut Grove newcomer Adam Simms falls in love with Miss Beadle, while his son Luke proves he's a chip off the old block by persuading Nellie Oleson to run away with him.(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: A Native American boy arrives in Walnut Grove seeking medical help for his desperately ill father, but faces racial hatred from the townsfolk. Drama, starring Michael Landon.(n)

programme.title: Providence
programme.desc: When she and Owen got their marriage licence, Syd begins to feel guilty about kissing Dr Baylor.(n)

programme.title: Providence
programme.desc: Syd misses her wedding shower, while Owen is invited to spend Thanksgiving with the Hansens.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Erin and Mary Ellen enter a traditionally all-male race to raise money for the war effort, with Elizabeth coaching them. Jeffrey dreams of meeting a movie star.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Jeffrey befriends a German prisoner of war who has escaped from a camp in North Carolina and hidden in the mountains, and the family asks him to join them for Christmas Eve.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Cindy is introduced to a self-help book on how to be the perfect wife, but when she follows the instructions found within she risks going into premature labour due to exhaustion.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: A soldier in Jason's company explains what is happening to the Jews at the hands of the Nazis in Europe. Meanwhile, Elizabeth gets teased for being such a smart student at school.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of Kathy McCormick
programme.desc: Romantic comedy about a woman from the wrong side of the tracks who falls for an elegant playboy and finds herself forced to lead a double life. Barbara Eden, Josh Taylor and Judy Geeson star.(n)

programme.title: Daniel's Daughter
programme.desc: A magazine editor receives news of her estranged father's death, and agrees to fulfil his final wish to scatter his ashes at the family's old home, an undertaking forces her to confront the past she left behind. Drama, starring Laura Leighton, London Angelis, Martin Doyle, Brandon Firla and Dorly Jean-Louis.(n)

programme.title: Danielle Steel's Daddy
programme.desc: An advertising executive's wife walks out, leaving him to raise their children alone - a problem compounded by his mother's death in a car accident. Drama, starring Patrick Duffy, Lynda Carter, Kate Mulgrew and featuring an early appearance by Ben Affleck.(n)

programme.title: At the Midnight Hour
programme.desc: A recently widowed scientist hires a nanny to care for his children, and surprises himself by falling head over heels in love with her. Romantic drama, based on Alicia Scott's best-selling novel, starring Simon MacCorkindale and Patsy Kensit.(n)

programme.title: Promises to Keep
programme.desc: An old man learns he has a terminal illness, and decides he needs to rebuild his relationship with the family he abandoned 30 years ago. However, his son finds it difficult to forgive him for leaving them. Drama, starring Robert Mitchum with his real-life son Christopher and great-nephew Bentley. With Tess Harper and Claire Bloom.(n)

programme.title: That'll Be the Day
programme.desc: A school dropout leaves home and drifts through a succession of dead-end jobs until he finds an outlet for his frustration in rock 'n' roll. Drama, starring David Essex, Ringo Starr, Keith Moon, Billy Fury, Robert Lindsay and Rosemary Leach.(n)

programme.title: Vantage Point
programme.desc: Eight strangers with eight different points of view try to unlock the truth behind an assassination attempt on the president of the United States. Thomas Barnes (Dennis Quaid) and Kent Taylor (Mathew Fox) are two Secret Service agents assigned to protect President Ashton (William Hurt) at a landmark summit on the global war on terror. When President Ashton is shot moments after his arrival in Spain, chaos ensues and disparate lives collide in the hunt for the assassin.

programme.title: American Carnage
programme.desc: As violence erupts in Charlottesville, the president’s unwillingness to denounce the racist hate groups presents a new test for journalists. Trump blames the “failing New York Times” and “crooked media” for distorting his speech and further deepening the country’s divisions. Meanwhile, Steve Bannon exits the White House and a Times reporter questions where his populist revolution is headed now, as the paper deals with reining in its own reporters on Twitter.

programme.title: Man On A Ledge
programme.desc: When former NYPD officer turned prison escapee Nick Cassidy (Sam Worthington) enters the famed Roosevelt Hotel on 45th and Madison in New York City, heads to one of the highest floors and steps out a window onto the ledge, he threatens more than just his own well-being. A whole city is about to seize up, including some very nervous people with some very big secrets. Elizabeth Banks, Ed Harris and Edward Burns co-star in this propulsive, twisty action thriller.

programme.title: Erik Griffin: AmERIKan Warrior
programme.desc: The comedian returns for his second Showtime special. While tackling subjects like white guilt, the national anthem and the righteously religious, he simultaneously skewers his own sense of male entitlement. Recorded in Portland, OR, Erik holds a mirror up to his audience's hypocrisies and nudges them into laughter while doing some corrective rejiggering on recently accepted societal norms.

programme.title: Bad Santa
programme.desc: Criminals Willie (Tony Cox) and Marcus (Billy Bob Thornton) disguise themselves as Santa Claus and his elf and travel across the country to major malls, using the good will people have toward Santa to rob the stores blind. However, Willie can't stand kids and it's all he can do to keep himself from getting fired while on the job. Their plan progresses beautifully until the two meet an introverted 8-year-old boy who thinks Willie is the real Santa Claus, and strikes real sympathy in him.

programme.title: Apollo 13
programme.desc: When a fuel leak threatens to strand three astronauts in space, the ground crew and the mission team must struggle to avert catastrophe. The team's solutions are ingenious, led by Academy Award winner Tom Hanks. Directed by Academy Award winner Ron Howard, this is the gripping true story of the 1970's ill-fated moon voyage.

programme.title: My One and Only
programme.desc: After she catches her husband cheating on her, a charming, flamboyant socialite packs her two young sons into a Coupe de Ville and embarks on a cross-country journey to find a new head of the family. Renee Zellweger, Logan Lerman and Kevin Bacon star in this comedy-drama loosely based on a true story.

programme.title: A Dog's Purpose
programme.desc: A devoted dog (voiced by Josh Gad) finds the meaning of his own existence through the lives of the humans he teaches to laugh and love. Also starring Dennis Quaid, Britt Robertson, K.J. Apa, Peggy Lipton and Pooch Hall.

programme.title: Collide
programme.desc: Casey, a young American backpacker in Germany, falls in love with Juliette, a fellow American traveling through Europe. She is diagnosed with a fatal disease, and Casey decides to steal from German gangster Hagen, in order to pay for the medical treatment which could save Juliette's life. Casey's heist doesn't go as planned and Hagen catches him. He manages to escape Hagen's men, steal one of Hagen's cars, and flee. Pursued across Germany, he races to save his own life and get to Juliette before Hagen's men get to her first.

programme.title: Margin Call
programme.desc: Set in the high-stakes world of the ﬁnancial industry, this film follows the key players at an investment ﬁrm during a 24-hour period in the early stages of the 2008 ﬁnancial crisis. When an entry-level analyst unlocks information that could prove to be the downfall of the ﬁrm, a roller-coaster ride ensues as decisions both ﬁnancial and moral catapult the lives of all involved into mayhem.

programme.title: Pork Pie
programme.desc: A trio of accidental outlaws travel the length of New Zealand in a yellow Mini, protesting conformity and chasing lost love, with a posse of cops and a media frenzy hot in their pursuit.

programme.title: Kill Bill: Vol. 2
programme.desc: In this sequel to the Quentin Tarantino cult classic, a murderous bride continues her quest for vengeance against her former boss and lover and those who betrayed her, leading up to the ultimate confrontation with the man who ordered her execution. Stars Uma Thurman.

programme.title: Kill Bill: Vol. 1
programme.desc: A woman emerges from a coma four years after taking a bullet to the head at her own wedding, and goes on an epic vendetta against her former boss and his deadly squad of international assassins in a kill or be-killed fight. Directed by Quentin Tarantino; stars Uma Thurman and Lucy Liu.

programme.title: Dean
programme.desc: Demetri Martin plays an illustrator who falls hard for an LA woman (Gillian Jacobs) while trying to prevent his father (Kevin Kline) from selling the family home in the wake of his mother's death.

programme.title: Elmsley Count
programme.desc: Axe dominates a capital raise event, but is soon challenged by an unexpected competitor. Chuck looks to strike the ultimate blow on an enemy. Wendy reckons with past decisions, and chooses a side. Connerty confronts Sacker about Chuck's activities. Taylor takes a big position. Season finale.(n)

programme.title: At Last
programme.desc: Patrick confronts the past on the day of his mother's memorial service. Now truly clean and sober, he attempts to solve the puzzle of his mother’s complicity in his father’s abuse, as well as answer his father’s question, ‘What will you do with your life?’ Limited Series Finale.(n)

programme.title: Frank the Plank
programme.desc: A manhunt ensues after Frank goes on a bender and turns up missing on Friday, the day he never fails to cash his disability check, and turns up in Toronto with no idea how he got there.(n)

credits.director: Graphic Language, Adult Content, Nudity, Mild Violence

programme.title: The Arrival
programme.desc: Romesh arrives in America and immediately gets to work on the daunting task of selling out the six thousand seat Greek Theater while having no profile or connections in America. Romesh also takes the first steps to put down roots in Los Angeles when he finds friendship in an unlikely place. Series premiere.(n)

programme.title: The Uncle
programme.desc: Romesh's Uncle Ragu arrives from Australia and is determined to help Rom make it in Hollywood, despite having no experience. Uncle Rags has a plan for Romesh that causes a scene captured on national television.(n)

programme.title: Elmsley Count
programme.desc: Axe dominates a capital raise event, but is soon challenged by an unexpected competitor. Chuck looks to strike the ultimate blow on an enemy. Wendy reckons with past decisions, and chooses a side. Connerty confronts Sacker about Chuck's activities. Taylor takes a big position. Season finale.(n)

programme.title: Beyond the Opposite Sex
programme.desc: This documentary picks up the respective stories of Rene and Jamie, 13 years after their Gender Affirmation Surgeries. The two subjects let us back into their very changed worlds and find that their surgeries, which had been lifelong goals, were far from the finish line of their journeys - in fact, they turned out to be only the beginning of more difficult, arduous and true lifelong experiences.(n)

programme.title: The Edge of Seventeen
programme.desc: Nadine (Hailee Steinfeld) and Krista (Haley Lu Richardson) are inseparable best friends attempting to navigate high school together, until Nadine's older brother Darian (Blake Jenner) and Krista begin dating. With her view of the world rocked, Nadine is forced to see the people in her life, including her well-meaning but distracted mother (Kyra Sedgwick), and unlikely mentor and History teacher Mr. Bruner (Woody Harrelson), with fresh eyes and new appreciation. She realizes that people - and life - are more complicated than she thought.(n)

programme.title: Dean
programme.desc: Demetri Martin plays an illustrator who falls hard for an LA woman (Gillian Jacobs) while trying to prevent his father (Kevin Kline) from selling the family home in the wake of his mother's death.(n)

programme.title: Middle School: The Worst Years of My Life
programme.desc: Rafe has an epic imagination and a slight problem with authority. When he transfers to a new school, Rafe and his scheming best friend Leo hatch a plan to break every rule in the school's code of conduct. This causes a battle with the principal, which explodes into chaos both real and imagined. Rafe struggles to hide his misbehavior from Jeanne, the straight-A, overachieving girl of his dreams, while at home, his mother's boyfriend - a moochy, jack-of-no-trades named Bear - threatens to become his stepfather.(n)

programme.title: I, Daniel Blake
programme.desc: Daniel Blake (Dave Johns) is a man out of time. He's a widowed woodworker who's never owned a computer and lives according to his own common sense moral code. After a heart attack leaves him unable to work and the state welfare system fails him, Daniel must stand up and fight for his dignity and lead a one-man crusade for compassion that transforms the lives of a single mother (Hayley Squires) and her two children.(n)

programme.title: Skinwalkers
programme.desc: A young boy on the cusp of manhood becomes the focus of a long-running war between factions of werewolves in this gritty horror fantasy starring Jason Behr, Matthew Knight, Rhona Mitra and Elias Koteas.(n)

programme.title: S.W.A.T.: Firefight
programme.desc: Transferred to Detroit to put a local SWAT team through a training regimen, LAPD Lieutenant Paul Cutler finds himself the target of a homicidal genius who is protected by government officials.(n)

programme.title: The Gunman
programme.desc: Sean Penn stars as Jim Terrier, an ex-special forces government contractor who is betrayed by the organization he once worked for and must go on the run in a relentless game of cat and mouse across Africa and Europe.(n)

programme.title: Push (2009)
programme.desc: A clairvoyant teenager (Dakota Fanning) and a telekinetic fugitive (Chris Evans) team up to find a missing woman who is the key to exposing a sinister, secret government agency that's building a clandestine army of psychic warriors. Djimon Hounsou costars in this sci-fi action thriller.(n)

programme.title: Before I Fall
programme.desc: Sam (Zoey Deutch) seems to have everything a teenage girl could want: popularity, a hot boyfriend, cool status, fun friends, loving family and seeming happiness. But beyond the superficial, Sam's life isn't so charmed. She is one of a clique of high school mean girls who make life hell for those who are different. When Sam is killed in a car accident, she is forced to relive her last day on Earth seven times in order to get things right. She attempts to make sense of what befell her and gain a better understanding of herself and others.(n)

programme.title: Bad Moms
programme.desc: Over-worked, over-committed and exhausted, Amy joins forces with two other stressed moms on a quest to liberate themselves from conventional responsibilities - going on a long overdue binge of freedom and fun that puts them on a collision course with the head of the PTA and her clique of perfect moms.(n)

programme.title: The Family
programme.desc: Romesh’s wife Leesa and their three kids arrive in Los Angeles. Leesa wants to help Romesh live a healthier lifestyle and goes to some extreme measures to achieve this, while Uncle Rags causes another major problem for Rom.(n)

programme.title: The TV Debut
programme.desc: Romesh reaches out to some comedy managers to help him get his first American television appearance. He also has to prove to Leesa that he has found a solution for the education of their kids in Los Angeles.(n)

programme.title: Walking Out
programme.desc: Once a year, fourteen-year-old David (Josh Wiggins) travels from his mother's home in Texas to visit his loner father, Cal (Matt Bomer), in the remote mountains of Montana. There, the two embark on their annual hunting excursion, during which the taciturn Cal attempts to connect with his smartphone-addicted son. But when a terrifying turn of events leaves Cal critically wounded, it's up to the teenage David to summon enough strength for both of them.(n)

programme.title: At Last
programme.desc: Patrick confronts the past on the day of his mother's memorial service. Now truly clean and sober, he attempts to solve the puzzle of his mother’s complicity in his father’s abuse, as well as answer his father’s question, ‘What will you do with your life?’ Limited Series Finale.(n)

programme.desc: Adam and Ralph get some good news. Goldie calls Amanda’s bluff. Ron tries to salvage good will from employers and coworkers. Adam assesses his relationship with Gloria. Bill helps Nick face legal trouble, while Nick confronts his Uncle Chris. Eddie receives a tough lesson in love from Roy. Cassie bonds with Dawn.(n)

programme.title: Double Take
programme.desc: Framed in a multimillion-dollar laundering scheme, upstanding investment banker Daryl (Orlando Jones) suddenly finds himself running from the FBI and swapping identities with petty thief Freddy (Eddie Griffin). As he dashes for the Mexican border in search of the one man who can clear his name, Daryl discovers his new alias is even more wanted than he is.(n)

programme.title: Operation Odessa
programme.desc: This is a true crime documentary featuring a Russian mobster, a Miami playboy and a Cuban spy who sold a Soviet submarine to a Colombian drug cartel for $35 million. A mid-'90s gangster epic that hopscotches from Brooklyn to Miami and Cali to Moscow, the film tells the story of three friends who set out to hustle the Russian mob, the Cali cartel and the DEA for the score of a lifetime.(n)

programme.title: Christine
programme.desc: High school geek Arnie Cunningham falls in love with Christine, a bright red 1957 Plymouth Fury which has seen much better days. After restoring the car to its original condition, his friends notice that the car is not the only thing that is changing. Arnie seems to spend more and more time with his car. He's also developed a cocky arrogance which does not seem like the real Arnie at all.(n)

programme.title: Swing Away
programme.desc: Following a meltdown that leads to a suspension, professional golfer Zoe Papadopoulos travels to her grandparents' village in Greece to escape the harsh spotlight of the international sports world. Between baking bread and eating baklava, she meets and mentors a ten-year-old girl who is determined to become the next golf sensation. Along the way, Zoe rediscovers her Greek heritage, her love of the game and the hidden strength within herself.(n)

programme.title: Patriots Day
programme.desc: In the aftermath of the Boston Marathon bombing, Police Sergeant Tommy Saunders (Mark Wahlberg) joins courageous survivors, first responders and investigators in a race against the clock to hunt down the bombers before they strike again. The stories of Special Agent Richard Deslauriers (Kevin Bacon), Police Commissioner Ed Davis (John Goodman), Sergeant Jeffrey Pugliese (J.K. Simmons) and nurse Carol Saunders (Michelle Monaghan) are all woven together to show the strength of the city.(n)
